dt.t: She felt {wi}ashamed{/wi} for hitting her brother.
Losing is nothing to be {wi}ashamed{/wi} of.
He was deeply {wi}ashamed{/wi} of his behavior.

dt: {bc}reluctant or unwilling to do something because of shame or embarrassment

dt.t: I was {wi}ashamed{/wi} to be seen with him.
I'm not {wi}ashamed{/wi} to admit that I don't know the answer.

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}āscamod{/it}, past participle of {it}āscamian{/it} to shame, from {it}ā-{/it} (perfective prefix) + {it}scamian{/it} to shame {ma}{mat|abide|}, {mat|shame|}{/ma}
shortdef: reluctant or unwilling to do something because of shame or embarrassment
